results.title: Designed for living
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Presents Canada’s accomplishments in industrial design, and the National Industrial Design Council’s encouragement of good design for contemporary living by illustrating a wide selection of household articles. The film defines good design, providing a yardstick for the consumer to use in assessing the merits of manufactured goods, ranging from kitchen utensils to living room furniture. Written by Lois Edwards; photography by John Spotton; editing by Dennis Sawyer; music by Eldon Rathburn; Voice and Narration by Maude Ferguson.

results.title: Design for irrigation: reconstructure of the home farm. Pt 1
results.brief_description: Shows that a proper plan of irrigation is essential when planting new orchards. The example in the film is a new block of slightly sloping land which is to be planted with fruit trees. A model of the block shows the contours, and the method of ploughing, irrigating and planting which should be carried out in relation to the contour lines.

results.title: Design for climate
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, S.T. Evans and Building Research and Development Advisory Committee
results.brief_description: Research on problems of building design for Australian conditions. Maintaining an acceptable indoor climate by economic means involves a building of suitable thermal characteristics using insulation and heating and cooling as required, proper lighting and ventilation. The noise problem, protection of external surfaces and relating the building to its environment for best use of the natural climate are considered.

results.title: Design for assembly
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Humphrey Barron and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Approaching Automation”.
Discusses ways of increasing productivity by means of (1) design liaison with production engineers and sales personnel and, (2) low-cost automating techniques for small and medium batch assembly lines. Industrialists, engineers and consultants are interviewed to show the lessons that can be learned from their experiences.
